column4: Why does /etc/init.d/networking fail when /etc/network/interfaces contains the following line at the end: "post-up /etc/network/if-up.d/zoneedit"? I have an /etc/network/if-up.d/zoneedit file marked +x.
who owns zoneedit?
Zoneedit?
yes.
root:root with permissions 700.
okay, what happens if you change it to 755?
Same thing.
would you mind pastebining the contents of the file?
ah, you need to make it a proper shell script
add this to the top of the file:  #!/bin/sh
Failed againl.
even if you run it on its own?
Nope.
'nope', meaning that it failed?
It works running as a shell script.
maybe you need to add an 'exit 0' to the end
Didn't help.
where does the error occur? what exactly are you typing for it to happen?
/etc/init.d/networking restart.
have you tried it with just up instead of post-up?
Will do.
go back to post-up and try: service networking stop && service networking start   instead of restart
